CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper January 18, 1958, pg. 2, reads: "Juvenile Appreciation - When youngsters on the beat, which he used to patrol in Lawrenceville, heard of newly appointed City Detective John Henry King's (kneeling, center) success, they took up a collection and presented him with a cigarette lighter in appreciation for his efforts in 'keeping them straight' and enforcing a curfew of his own. Disc Jockey Bill Powell defrayed part of the cost of the gift. City Magistrate John J. Fiorucci of Lawrenceville is standing behind the detective. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Children and teenagers gathered around City Detective John Henry King squatting, with Alderman John J. Fiorucci standing behind him, on sidewalk in front of Fiorucci's office, street no. 3404, Lawrenceville
